image.altText: A blonde man in his 40s wearing a blue suit and tie walking in front of a road in Adelaide

props.synopsis: The former SA Liberal leader pleaded guilty to two counts of supplying or administering a drug that wasn't cannabis to another person.

title.children: Breaking: Former SA opposition leader David Speirs pleads guilty to drug charges

image.altText: Four police officers stand around the entrance to a block of units. Rubbish bags on top of bins are in the foreground

props.synopsis: Police say the death of a woman in her early 40s is no longer being treated as suspicious.

title.children: Woman's death in Adelaide's south no longer treated as suspicious

image.altText: Two lead smelters side by side in a composite image

props.synopsis: The operator of smelters in South Australia and Tasmania is urging state and federal governments to provide "essential" financial support, after its facilities were described as "uncompetitive assets".

title.children: Owner of ‘uneconomical’ Port Pirie and Hobart smelters calls for government help to stay afloat

image.altText: A view of the Whyalla steelworks.

props.synopsis: Whyalla steelworks administrator KordaMentha says it has identified up to a dozen "interested parties" as it seeks to secure a sale of the business by the end of the year, and has also praised the "MacGyver-like" ingenuity of local workers contending with a plant in need of repair.

title.children: Whyalla's 'MacGyver-like' steelworkers praised as site on track for sale

image.altText: A man in t-shirt and glasses smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Gold Coast retiree Adrian Sim says the treasurer has announced a "retail budget" full of sugar hits. And he is not the only one disappointed.

title.children: Australians say the budget lacks bravery and 'long-term vision'

image.altText: A young woman touching virtual screen with checkbox lists.

props.synopsis: Artificial intelligence has crept into almost every corner of our lives. So with the federal election looming, BTN High speaks to young people about how they think it will influence voting and how to tell if it's the real deal.

title.children: How to spot AI ahead of the federal election

image.altText: A sinkhole surrounded by rock and greenery and a viewing platform.

props.synopsis: The Mount Gambier council is seeking expressions of interests from companies wanting to hire out electric scooters in the city, but there are concerns they could be thrown into the Cave Gardens.

title.children: E-scooter trial despite fears they will be thrown into sinkhole

image.altText: Jake Lehmann running between wickets after hitting a cricket shot in the Sheffield Shield final

props.synopsis: South Australia has a lead of more than 100 runs against Queensland on the second day of the Sheffield Shield final. Follow all the live scores and stats.

title.children: Sheffield Shield final live: South Australia push lead past 100 against Queensland

image.altText: Donald Trump frowns.

props.synopsis: This week's story about Washington's group chat mix-up has prompted debate over what constitutes "war plans" and whether the material was classified. The Atlantic has now published the full chat.

title.children: What we learned when Washington's war group chat was published in full

image.altText: Natasha Stott Despoja at South Australia's Royal Commission into Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence.

props.synopsis: South Australians living with a disability have reportedly had their hands shackled with rope, their wheelchair tyres punctured and food withheld by family members and carers, the state's domestic violence royal commission has heard.

title.children: People living with disability subjected to 'terrible things', DV royal commission hears

image.altText: An elderly man in a jumper smiles for a family photo

props.synopsis: An inquest has heard an elderly man who died after driving on the wrong side of a highway in 2019 was pulled over by police weeks earlier. The officer says he believes the man was "incapable of driving on the road at the time", but could not stop him from driving.

title.children: Police had no power to remove licence from elderly man before fatal crash, inquest told

image.altText: A sign at the Women's and Children's Hospital in North Adelaide.

props.synopsis: Surgical equipment which was compromised when humidity in a storage room rose above threshold levels put 38 Women's and Children's Hospital patients at "low risk", the hospital's management has revealed.

title.children: Patients at risk after surgical equipment compromised by humidity

image.altText: A man standing on a beach holding a dead cuttlefish in his right hand

props.synopsis: A microalgae "toxic to fish but not humans" has been identified as the cause of a bloom linked to octopus and other marine deaths along SA beaches, with environment authorities saying the algae has flourished "marine heatwave" and "warmer-than-usual" sea temperatures.

title.children: Toxic microalgae identified as cause of bloom linked to marine deaths

image.altText: A crowd of men and women wearing traditional bridal attire all shout in unison

props.synopsis: The Unification Church has had close ties to world politics for decades, but a court ruling in Japan could be the end of the organisation.

title.children: A church with links to Trump, coups and Soviet Union leaders faces dissolution

image.altText: A large white boat with TACOMA on its hull

props.synopsis: After pioneering tuna fishing in Port Lincoln more than 70 years ago, the Tacoma has just delivered water to a parched sheep farm on an island off the Eyre Peninsula.

title.children: Historic tuna boat delivers much-needed water to thirsty island sheep

image.altText: CCTV footage of a store alight

props.synopsis: Successive governments have increased the tax on cigarettes and tobacco to drive down smoking rates — but having helped with one problem, it has contributed to another.

title.children: Up in smoke: How Australia's fight with big tobacco fuelled a black market

image.altText: Hundreds of Palestinians protesting on the streets in Gaza with banners and signs

props.synopsis: The rare protests follow Israel's resumption of attacks on Gaza following a nearly two-month ceasefire.

title.children: 'We want to stop the killing': Why Gazans are protesting against Hamas

image.altText: Kim Jong Un stands with back to camera as a drone flies off in the distance.

props.synopsis: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has supervised the test of suicide drones with artificial intelligence technology, according to state media.

title.children: North Korea tests AI suicide drone as Kim Jong Un looks on, says state media

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Elon Musk standing behind a podium, raising his fists in the air and shouting.

props.synopsis: Records revealed by Reuters show the teen, who now has access to departments including Homeland Security, provided services to a cyber crime ring known as "EGodly" prior to his US government role.

title.children: Teen member of Musk's DOGE once provided support to a cybercrime gang

image.altText: two men walk through a doorway

props.synopsis: French President Emmanuel Macron says European forces could be used to dissuade future Russian attacks once a peace deal is in place in Ukraine.

title.children: Macron says European forces 'a card in the hand of the Ukrainians'

image.altText: A blurred photo of the share trading boards at the Australian stock exchange

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is down in early trade after Wall Street and European stocks were hit by the looming threat of tariffs on US car imports. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX and global stocks fall as more US tariffs shake sentiment

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Why Healius shares are rising today
Toyota, Mazda, Subaru shares slide on Trump auto tariff
Australian shares remain in the red

image.altText: Generic child toys

props.synopsis: New analysis reveals just how lucrative Australia's childcare real estate market is while parents face perpetual fee hikes.

title.children: As investors rush to buy up childcare centres, fees are rising sharply

image.altText: A whole, halved and sliced Shepard avocado, one variety commonly available in Australia.

props.synopsis: Hass avocados are out of season for the next few months, meaning those craving an avo fix may have to turn to the often-maligned Shepard variety. But despite the bad rap, Shepard avocados have their own strengths.

title.children: How to start enjoying Shepard avocados as Hass become harder to find

image.altText: A man with a septum piercing and white beard and long hair wearing a beanie outside while it snows

props.synopsis: The US conspiracy theorist charged in connection with a deadly attack on Queensland police has told authorities he would have tried to talk the killers out of it if he had the chance.

title.children: Man charged in connection with Wieambilla attack wished he was with shooters

image.altText: A woman types on a laptop computer.

props.synopsis: Nicole hadn't been in her sales job for even a year when she resigned, but her former employer is now trying to stop her working in the same industry for the next six months.

title.children: 'A huge hit to my career': Junior worker faces six month non-compete

image.altText: A sign on the front of a building saying 'Genius Childcare', photographed through bars.

props.synopsis: After months of complaints about unpaid wages, landlord disputes and child health and safety breaches, Genius has sold off at least six childcare centres.

title.children: Failed childcare boss sells six Genius centres to ex-business partner

image.altText: NT Deputy Chief Minister Gerard Maley, standing under a large tree and looking serious.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's renewables minister says the government is scrapping a target of 50 per cent renewable energy by 2030, labelling it an "unrealistic and failed policy".

title.children: NT government scraps territory's 50 per cent renewables target

image.altText: A dozen fall army worm specimens on a laboratory agar plate showing signs of a white fungus which killed them.

props.synopsis: The insect said to threaten the food security of 600 million people globally may have met its match in the form of several native Australian fungi and bacteria.

title.children: Killing an unkillable pest insect made possible with Australian fungi

image.altText: A couple at the pub

props.synopsis: Despite Australians paying almost $7 billion for group insurance within super annually, new research shows more than a quarter aren't aware if they have cover or the details of their policies.

title.children: Lyndal was in the dark about her super insurance until she claimed

image.altText: Melbourne International Comedy Festival

props.synopsis: An audience member suffered a medical emergency during the Allstars Supershow at the Palais Theatre in St Kilda.

title.children: Melbourne comedy festival opening stopped due to death in audience

image.altText: An unidentified mother and two young children on a round swing in a playground.

props.synopsis: A new report into the massive over-representation of Indigenous children in out-of-home care in Western Australia reveals how factors like homelessness and DV can lead to mothers having their babies taken away.

title.children: Molly was hospitalised after a DV assault — so her baby was taken away

image.altText: A generic graphic of the NDIS logo surrounded by budget-related paraphenalia.

props.synopsis: The NDIS is getting a lot of negative press at the moment. It’s a far cry from when the scheme first started, writes Evan Young.

title.children: There's another problem facing the NDIS. It's probably not what you think

props.synopsis: Rainfall records at some outback properties have been smashed with major flooding set to continue across parts of western Queensland. The rain band is expected to head east in time for the weekend.

title.children: Outback Qld residents, livestock stranded as 'daunting' rain continues
